results.headline: Review: Melissa McCarthy Is Criminally Good in ‘Can You Ever Forgive Me?’
results.summary_short: Marielle Heller directs a true story of literary fraud, set amid the bookstores and gay bars of early ’90s Manhattan.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Can You Ever Forgive Me

results.headline: Review: ‘Charm City’ Vividly Captures the Streets of Baltimore
results.summary_short: Marilyn Ness’s documentary is dedicated to the memory of the more than 1,000 people said to be killed in Baltimore during the film’s making.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Charm City

results.display_title: Horn from the Heart: The Paul Butterfield Story
results.headline: Review: Paul Butterfield’s Story Is Told in ‘Horn From the Heart’
results.summary_short: A documentary explores the life of the blues musician who was prominent in the 1960s and ’70s.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Horn from the Heart: The Paul Butterfield Story

results.headline: Review: ‘The Price of Everything’ Asks $56 Billion Questions About Art
results.summary_short: This documentary examines the global art market, and pauses to look at some pictures along the way.

results.headline: Review: ‘Impulso’ Goes Backstage With a Flamenco Innovator
results.summary_short: This documentary follows Rocío Molina, a cutting-edge dancer, as she prepares for a Paris show.

results.headline: Review: ‘Watergate’ Shocks Anew With Its True Tale of Political Scandal
results.summary_short: Charles Ferguson delivers a comprehensive documentary about the not-so-distant past, with its eye very much on the present.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Watergate

results.headline: Review: In ‘Barbara,’ a Fictional Biopic of a French Chanteuse
results.summary_short: It’s a film of scenes rather than of one unified narrative, but each scene is a showcase for the magnificent talents of its star.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Barbara

results.headline: Review: A Russian Gymnast Goes ‘Over the Limit’
results.summary_short: Margarita Mamun endures injury and abuse in Marta Prus’s brilliantly constructed documentary.

results.headline: Review: The Disturbing Obsession of ‘The Kindergarten Teacher’
results.summary_short: Maggie Gyllenhaal is riveting as a dissatisfied teacher who’s obsessed with her 5-year-old pupil’s poetic talent.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Classical Period,’ a Deep Dive — Really Deep — Into Dante
results.summary_short: This highly original feature is technically in English, but it might as well be in liberal-arts-speak.

results.display_title: Bad Times at the El Royale
results.headline: Review: Hard-Boiled Play in ‘Bad Times at the El Royale’
results.summary_short: The writer-director Drew Goddard has fun with genre and a cast that includes Jeff Bridges, Dakota Johnson, Jon Hamm, Cynthia Erivo and Chris Hemsworth.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Beautiful Boy,’ a Writer Confronts His Son’s Meth Addiction
results.summary_short: Two memoirs are brought to the screen in a father-son drama starring Steve Carell and Timothée Chalamet.

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Oath,’ a Pledge of Allegiance to a President Creates Chasms
results.summary_short: This satirical comedy, written, directed by and starring Ike Barinholtz, turns dark and ham-handed.

results.headline: Review: ‘Bikini Moon’ Finds a Documentary Crew Under Its Subject’s Spell
results.summary_short: Condola Rashad plays the title character, a homeless women who manipulates, and is manipulated by, filmmakers who soon have their own problems.

results.headline: Review: ‘Goosebumps 2: Haunted Halloween’ Is Toothless Terror
results.summary_short: This sequel to the movie adaptation of R.L. Stine’s horror series is more goofy than scary.

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Sentence,’ a Woman Gets Prison, Her Family Also Pays
results.summary_short: The documentary denounces minimum sentencing laws that put Cindy Shank behind bars.

results.headline: Review: In ‘All Square,’ Taking Big Bets on Youth Baseball
results.summary_short: Michael Kelly, Pamela Adlon and Josh Lucas enhance the small-town bookmaking shenanigans of this comedy-drama.

results.headline: Review: The Drama ‘Sadie’ Finds a Teenager in a Tough Situation
results.summary_short: The film stars Sophia Mitri Schloss as the title character, a 13-year-old girl who grows angry at the men who are courting her mother.

results.headline: Review: In ‘After Everything,’ a Young Love Blooms in Crisis
results.summary_short: This cancer drama focuses less on the high stakes of illness than on how two young people talk to each other in sickness and in health.

results.headline: Review: ‘First Man’ Takes a Giant Leap for Man, a Smaller Step for Movies
results.summary_short: Damien Chazelle’s sweeping and intimate yet underwhelming film revisits the first lunar landing, with Ryan Gosling as Neil Armstrong.
